skillTree.localised_description: The strength of this Vampire to endure the centuries is beyond compare.
The wails of a Banshee can be lethal and strike terror into the hearts of any who hear them.
Whereby the power of death itself is used to hold back the physical world.
Although a great many centuries have passed, Xu Yaoji's spirit still burns with a great hatred for her former 'benefactors'; blaming them for her people's fate.

effects.description:
Melee attack: +6 when fighting against Elves
	(Lord's army)

Charge bonus: +8 when fighting against Elves
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: These crumbling, rusty chains were used to bind Xu Yaoji, believed by the High Elves to keep her from being reborn in undeath, dangling down her battered corpse like metal vines.
Xu Yaoji witnessed the mass suicide and murder of her fellow Cathayans as well as the brutal deaths of the remaining hospital staff as the Rite of Impermanence silenced the island.
Phantom structures were rumored to have been phasing in and out of reality along the Sea of Dread for centuries; their true nature, still unknown to most imperial folklorists.

effects.description:
Construction cost: -30% for all buildings
	(all provinces)

Vampire Corruption + 5 to local province
	(all provinces)

skillTree.localised_description: As with Xu Yaoji, the elves of Danoi Sariour were also trapped in that accursed sanatorium; their restless souls still reliving their agonizing ends.

ui_effects.localised_text: Will spread to enemies within the Spread Range metres of affected unit

attributes.bullet_text:
A Rampaging unit is uncontrollable and will attack the nearest enemy unit.
	When there are no enemy units nearby, a Rampaging unit will move around randomly instead.

A Rampaging unit is uncontrollable and will attack the nearest enemy unit.
	When there are no enemy units nearby, a Rampaging unit will move around randomly instead.

skillTree.localised_description: A drawn blade should not be put away until slaked in blood.
This being fights dirty, no honour system applies here!
"Stay in one place, gods-damn you!"
Whether a targeted slice to the throat, or a precision stab to the heart, this one knows how to kill!
Those who are fleet of foot can reach the enemy faster.
Forsaken by men and gods, the dead can only futily curse and rage at those that survived them.
Always on the lookout for an opening or advantage in battle - somewhere to put the knife in…
The harder they hit, the more they commit, the easier it is to strike back.
"The enemy's fear; their blood spilt in the mud – these are the things that sustain me."
Never trap this one, when cornered they have nothing left to lose.
Old, rusty chains used to bind the dead and prevent their reawakening. Although long forfeit of sacred properties, its violent pull can stay lesser men.
"I am mighty, none dare challenge me!"

effects.description:
Enemy leadership: -4
	(enemy armies in local province)

skillTree.localised_description: "A wall of decaying flesh and bone slowly advanced towards us, implacable and utterly remorseless."

skillTree.localised_description: All manners of bogeys and fiends that lurk in the dark wood, idling patiently as the sun sets into the horizon -- and the night begins.

skillTree.localised_description: In the East, tales of ghosts are often brought up to scare and discipline children or spread around as petty entertainment, but in crumbling abodes and forgotten clanhouses, lingering spirits exist, languishing in murderous rage.

skillTree.localised_description: The Cathayan underworld is home to many immetarial creatures, and some of these aren't as benevolent as Cathay's venerated ancestors.

skillTree.localised_description: "Charge, brothers! We are sworn-comrades in life, and now, in DEATH! For Xen Yang! For the Dragon Emperor!"

skillTree.localised_description: Grandy Cathay is home to many supernatural abominations that stalk the night and maliciously feast upon the populace's nightmares.

skillTree.localised_description: The endurance of boogeymen and other nightly frights that haunt the Cathayan psyche is perhaps one of the more intriguing aspects of their culture.

skillTree.localised_description: Not only satisfied in enacting revenge, some spirits go as far as to inflict misery and torment upon the living out of misplaced wrath and perceived injustices.

	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: At sunset, when all the windows are barred and the crows have cawwed, the dread denizens of the night encroach upon the world of mortals from the shadows.

effects.description:
Melee attack: +5 for Fell bats, Gore Hags, Mogwai, Devil of Dark Omen and Yaoguai (Rank 7 and above)
	(Lord's army)

Charge bonus: +9 for Fell bats, Gore Hags, Mogwai, Devil of Dark Omen and Yaoguai (Rank 7 and above)
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: Deathless horses with eyes that burn like brimstone and hooves that leave trails of ghostflame; the jade banner flashes its accursed colors.

effects.description:
Missile resistance: +15% for Youxia revenants and Cursed Jade Carriage units(Rank 7 and above)
	(Lord's army)

Speed: +8% for Youxia revenants and Cursed Jade Carriage units(Rank 7 and above)
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: A Lord of Necromancy's minions do not suffer exhaustion, they can walk for leagues and never suffer.
Once slain in battle, the foe belongs to the Undead Lord, and will rise again, eager to serve.

effects.description:
The Dead Rise Again: +5% hit points for destroyed Undead units restored after battle
	(Lord's army)

The Dead Rise Again: +10% hit points for destroyed Undead units restored after battle
	(Lord's army)

The Dead Rise Again: +15% hit points for destroyed Undead units restored after battle
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: A powerful, vigorous Lord of Darkness will see the Children of the Night gather unto them.

effects.description:
Character experience gain: +10%
	(Heroes in Lord's army)

Character experience gain: +20%
	(Heroes in Lord's army)

Character experience gain: +30%
	(Heroes in Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: The sun is no ally of the dead - a sky scorched black, or darkest night, will invigorate the Unliving.

effects.description:
Attrition: -10% casualties suffered from all attrition
	(Lord's army)

Attrition: -20% casualties suffered from all attrition
	(Lord's army)

Attrition: -30% casualties suffered from all attrition

skillTree.localised_description: Such long-lived creatures develop a level of guile that mortals cannot match.
Such a beast is all but impossible to destroy - an immortal horror doomed to haunt eternity!

effects.description:
Casualty replenishment rate: +30% for this Lord
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: "The time to strike is now!"

effects.description: Enables lightning strike battles when reinforcements are present

skillTree.localised_description: A simple glamour can disguise a monstrous Vampire or Liche, so they may then charm and beguile the local populace.

Vampire Corruption + 5 to local province

skillTree.localised_description: W'soran's scions are masters at the art of Necromancy, to dabble in such will be a boon.
This Lord has endless forbearance, a timeless patience crafted over millennia.

skillTree.localised_description: This Lord can hear the thoughts of mortals for leagues around, and plan accordingly.

effects.description:
Winds of Magic power reserve minimum: +15
	(Lord's army)

attributes.bullet_text: This unit counts as a Yin unit for the purpose of Battle Harmony proximity.
This unit can hide in forests until enemy units get too close.

Undead units cannot be routed, but take damage when their Leadership is broken.
	
	Undead units also have:
	 Fear and Terror Immunity
	
	Undead units may also have their hit points restored by special characters such as the Vampire Counts Necromancer.
This unit frightens all enemy units, reducing their leadership when nearby. It is also immune to fear. Fear penalties do not stack.
This unit can cause terror, making its melee target rout for a short time. Units that cause terror are immune to terror and fear themselves.
This unit provides a leadership bonus to nearby allies. Units within range of both the Lord's aura and an encouraging unit will receive the larger of the two bonuses.

ui_effects.localised_text: Activates when within 60 metres of a Yang unit.
Effect intensity increases by highest nearby Harmony multiplier on a unit.

factionEffects.localised_description: Damned victims of the Danoi Sariour Sanatorium, whose cursed plague still permeates centuries after they terrible fate.

effects.description: Battering rams: +1 per siege item constructed
Siege towers: +2 per siege item constructed

ui_effects.localised_text: Greatly replenishes hit points of combatants

effects.description:
Enables "Plague of Sleep" but can be negated by using Army Abilities
	(all armies)

enabled_if: Unit vigour is worse than active

effects.description: Unique landmark in Towers of the Stars provides powerful faction buffs

related_attributes.bullet_text: Even when performing the most fatiguing actions, this unit never loses vigour.

backgroundSkills.localised_description: Studying all the alchemic secrets she had learned from the Order of the Verdant Serpent, Xu Yaoji was on the cusp of concocting a miraculous breakthrough; one that could have permanently crippled the effects of the Plague of Sleep. Alas, her mind had been devoured by the disease before she could perfect such a cure.

related_attributes.bullet_text: Even when performing the most fatiguing actions, this unit never loses vigour.

effects.description: This Lord will be wounded instead of killed in battle

Weapon strength: +18% for Hungry Ghost units
	(Lord's army)

Casualty replenishment rate +10% for Hungry Ghost units
	(Lord's army)
